Detailed Description

The text file output class.

Inherits CoreIO, so functions like CoreIO::Write and CoreIO::WriteLine are accessible to the programmer.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

TextWriter::TextWriter ( const char *  _file  ) 

The constructor.

Creates an instance of CoreIO with write access to the file specified in _file.

Parameters:
_file The path to the file being read.

TextWriter::~TextWriter (  ) 

The destructor.

Flushes the output buffer, closes the file, and deallocates memory used by TextWriter.

Determines whether the end of the file has been reached.

Returns:
Boolean indicating whether the end of the file has been reached.

Reimplemented from CoreIO.

int TextWriter::Forward ( int  _position  )  [inline, private, virtual]

Moves forward to a location in the buffer.

Parameters:
_position Position to seek to, relative to the current position in the buffer.
Returns:
An integer indicating the result of the operation. 0 indicates success. Any non-zero number indicates failure.

Reimplemented from CoreIO.

Determines the length of the file buffer.

int  _bufferLength,
int  _bufferIndex,
int  _count

Reads a block of data from the file buffer.

Parameters:
_buffer The output buffer to read to.
_bufferLength The size of _buffer (in bytes).
_bufferIndex The position in _buffer to begin writing.
_count The number of bytes to read.

Reimplemented from CoreIO.

char TextWriter::Read (  )  [inline, private, virtual]

Reads one byte from the file buffer.

Returns:
A char containing the next byte from the buffer.

Reimplemented from CoreIO.

const char* TextWriter::ReadLine (  )  [inline, private, virtual]

Reads a line of data.

Data returned by this function should be copied to another location before being parsed.

WARNING: This function is NOT thread-safe. A fix for this is in the works.
Returns:
A pointer to the next line of data.

Reimplemented from CoreIO.

int TextWriter::Seek ( int  _position  )  [inline, private, virtual]

Seeks to a location in the buffer.

Parameters:
_position Position to seek to, relative to the first byte of the buffer.
Returns:
An integer indicating the result of the operation. 0 indicates success. Any non-zero number indicates failure.

Reimplemented from CoreIO.
